names.english: ginseng, dang gui, and peony powder
names.commonEnglish: Ginseng, Dang Gui and Peony Powder

actions: Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold and regulates the menses.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
With Gan Cao, moderates spasms and relieves abdominal pain.
With Chuan Xiong, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Nourishes the Blood and regulates menstruation.
With Gan Cao, for abdominal pain due to disharmony between the Liver and Stomach.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and strengthens the Spleen.
With Bai Zhu, for a weak and deficient Spleen with fatigue, anorexia and loose stools.
With Gan Cao, for Spleen and Heart Deficiency causing facial edema, palpitations and shortness of breath.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, dries Dampness and promotes water metabolism.
With Fu Ling and Gan Cao, for Spleen and Stomach Qi Deficiency.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and settles Ministerial Fire in the Kidneys.
With Bai Zhu, for Spleen Deficiency leading to accumulation of Dampness with urinary difficulty, loose stools, diarrhea, Milky Lin or vaginal discharge.

With Fu Ling, facilitates the removal of water and leaches out Dampness to treat stagnant water and Dampness leading to edema, jaundice, diarrhea, Milky Lin, and scanty, difficult urination with abdominal distention.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Deficiency causing menstrual problems including dysmenorrhea, scanty menses and amenorrhea.
With Rou Gui, for irregular menstruation with Cold in the Blood.
Powerfully tonifies Yuan Qi, tonifies Spleen, Stomach Lung and Heart Qi and calms the Spirit.
With Bai Zhu, tonifies the transformation and transportation functions of the Spleen.
Warms the Kidneys, Spleen and Heart, strengthens Yang and Ming Men Fire, leads the Fire back to its source and assists in the generation of Qi and Blood.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates spasms and alleviates pain, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
With Bai Shao, moderates spasms and alleviates pain, for painful spasms of the leg or abdomen.
Tonifies Qi and Blood
Strengthens the Spleen
Tonifies Yang

symptoms: Sweating with little or no exertion
manifestations.tongueCoat: White or Thin, white and dry
manifestations.pulse: Slow, deep and weak or Empty or Thready and rapid or Weak
